plot outline: While golfing, Malvika Talwar meets with handsome, U.S.-returned Avinash, both fall in love with each other, and shortly thereafter get married. The following year, Malvika gives birth to a boy, and they decide to name him Ansh. Then chaos and devastation enters Malvika's life when Avinash gets killed in an automobile accident. Malvika resigns herself to a life of a widow, her sole motive for living appears to be to look after Ansh. She is shocked when her in-laws, Balraj, and Shobhana, ask her to re-marry. Will Malvika be able to remove Avinash from her heart and mind and marry someone else?

A wealthy Balraj Kapoor lives happily with his wife Shobhna and both are eagerly waiting fro their son Avinash to return from US after completing his education. Avinash returns home bringing more joy in the family and soon joins the business, he meets Malvika (Milli) at a golf course who brings Balraj in her bad books after he mistakenly spoils her painting. Avinash sees this opportunity and befriends Millie and both fall in love but Millie is secretly loved by her childhood friend Rajat. Mille finds that Avinash is son of Balraj and isn't happy with him, but Balraj apologizes for spoiling her painting and soon gets them married.Avinash and Mille soon have a son who grows up well during one of his birthday family is waiting for Avinash to cut the cake but he does not return as an accident kills him.Millie becomes widow at a very young age seeing this hurts Balraj badly who then meets Rajat and convinces him to get married to Mille but Shobhna and Balraj's elder brother Balwant opposes the decision but Balraj decides to fight against everyone for happiness of his daughter in law.::alex.mjacko@gmail.com

Orphan Rajat Verma loves his childhood friend, Malvika Talwar and would like to marry her. Before he could propose to her, she tells him that she is in love with wealthy Avinash Kapoor. She does get married to Avinash, but his paternal uncle, Balwant, does not approve of a hurried marriage. Balwant will be even more disappointed and angry, when a age-old Hindu tradition is breached during the marriage ceremony, thus setting a stage for more pain and tragedy in the lives of the Kapoor and Talwar families.::rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)
